      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.String userName,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws SpaceException,
                       SameIDException,
                       SameUserNameException,
                       java.io.IOException
        This method creates a user.
        name: createUser
        pre: The variable id, name, lastName, userName, password, are already initialized.
        post: the user has been created.
        Parameters:
        id - Is a String variable that contains the id number of the user. id!="" and id!=null.
        name - Is a String variable that contains the name of the user. name!="" and name!=null.
        lastName - Is a String variable that contains the lastName of the user. lastName!="" and lastName!=null.
        userName - Is a String variable that contains the user name of the user. userName!="" and userName!=null.
        password - Is a String variable that contains the password of the user. password!="" and password!=null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        SpaceException -
        thrown if... 1. The userName has a space in between.
        SameIDException -
        thrown if... 1. The id is the same as another user's.
        SameUserNameException -
        thrown if... 1. The userName is the same as another user's.

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(User user,
                       java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.String userName,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       boolean enabled,
                       java.lang.String email)
                throws SameIDException,
                       SameUserNameException,
                       SpaceException,
                       EmailException,
                       java.io.IOException
        This method updates a user.
        name: updateUser
        pre: The variable user, id, name, lastName, userName, password, enabled, email, are already initialized.
        post: the user has been created.
        Parameters:
        user - Is a User object that references the user that wants to be updated. user!=null
        id - Is a String variable that contains the id number of the user. id!="" and id!=null.
        name - Is a String variable that contains the name of the user. name!="" and name!=null.
        lastName - Is a String variable that contains the lastName of the user. lastName!="" and lastName!=null.
        userName - Is a String variable that contains the user name of the user. userName!="" and userName!=null.
        password - Is a String variable that contains the password of the user. password!="" and password!=null.
        email - Is a String variable that contains the email of the user. email!=null.
        enabled - Is a boolean variable that indicates if the user is enabled or not. enabled==true or enabled==false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        SpaceException -
        thrown if... 1. The userName has a space in between.
        SameIDException -
        thrown if... 1. The id is the same as another user's.
        SameUserNameException -
        thrown if... 1. The userName is the same as another user's.
        EmailException -
        thrown if... 1. The user is the user administrator and the email does not have an at sign.

      • createClient

        public void createClient(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String lastName,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String typeId,
                         java.lang.String address,
                         java.lang.String phone)
                  throws SameIDException,
                         java.io.IOException
        This method creates a client.
        name: createClient
        pre: The variable id, typeId, name, lastName, address, phone, are already initialized.
        post: the client has been created.
        Parameters:
        id - Is a String variable that contains the id number of the client. id!="" and id!=null.
        typeId - Is a String variable that contains the id type of the client. typeId=="TI", typeId=="CC",typeId=="PP", or typeId=="CE"
        name - Is a String variable that contains the name of the client. name!="" and name!=null.
        lastName - Is a String variable that contains the lastName of the client. lastName!="" and lastName!=null.
        address - Is a String variable that contains the address of the client. address!="" and address!=null.
        phone - Is a String variable that contains the phone of the client. phone!="" and phone!=null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        SameIDException -
        thrown if... 1. The id is the same as another client's.

      • addSortedClient

        public void addSortedClient(Client client)
        This method adds a client to the list in sorted order by its last name and name.
        name: addSortedClient
        pre: The variable client is already initialized.
        post: the client has been added to the list.

        public void updateClient(Client client,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String lastName,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String typeId,
                         java.lang.String address,
                         java.lang.String phone,
                         boolean enabled)
                  throws SameIDException,
                         java.io.IOException
        This method updates a client.
        name: updateClient
        pre: The variable client, id, typeId, name, lastName, address, phone, enabled, are already initialized.
        post: the client has been updated.
        Parameters:
        id - Is a String variable that contains the id number of the client. id!="" and id!=null.
        typeId - Is a String variable that contains the id type of the client. typeId=="TI", typeId=="CC",typeId=="PP", or typeId=="CE"
        name - Is a String variable that contains the name of the client. name!="" and name!=null.
        lastName - Is a String variable that contains the lastName of the client. lastName!="" and lastName!=null.
        address - Is a String variable that contains the address of the client. address!="" and address!=null.
        phone - Is a String variable that contains the phone of the client. phone!="" and phone!=null.
        client - Is a Client object that references the client that wants to be update. client!=null
        enabled - Is a boolean variable that indicates if the client is enabled or not. enabled==true or enabled==false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        SameIDException -
        thrown if... 1. The id is the same as another client's.

      • createCashReceipt

        public void createCashReceipt(java.util.ArrayList<Product> listProd,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> listQ,
                              Client buyer,
                              java.lang.String observations,
                              java.lang.String paymentMethod)
                       throws NoProductsAddedException,
                              UnderAgeException,
                              java.io.IOException
        This method creates a cash receipt.
        name: createCashReceipt
        pre: The variable listProd, listQ, buyer, observations, paymentMethod, are already initialized.
        post: the cash receipt has been created.
        Parameters:
        buyer - Is a Client object that references the client that wants to be added to the receipt. client!=null
        listProd - Is an ArrayList of Product that contains the list of products for the receipt. listProd!=null.
        listQ - Is an ArrayList of Integer that contains the list of quantities of products for the receipt. listQ!=null.
        observations - Is a String variable that contains the observations of the receipt. observations!="", observations !=null
        paymentMethod - Is a String variable that contains the name of the client. observations equals "Efectivo", observations equals "Tarjeta de debito", observations equals "Tarjeta de credito", or observations equals "Transferencia bancaria"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        NoProductsAddedException -
        thrown if... 1. The list of products is empty.
        UnderAgeException -
        thrown if... 1. The buyer is under age and wants to buy an electronic equipment.

      • createSeparateReceipt

        public void createSeparateReceipt(java.util.ArrayList<Product> listProd,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> listQ,
                                  Client buyer,
                                  java.lang.String paymentMethod,
                                  double valuePayment)
                           throws NoProductsAddedException,
                                  UnderAgeException,
                                  NoPriceException,
                                  NegativePriceException,
                                  java.io.IOException,
                                  ExcessValueException
        This method creates a separate receipt.
        name: createSeparateReceipt
        pre: The variable listProd, listQ, buyer, paymentMethod, valuePayment, are already initialized.
        post: the separate receipt has been created.
        Parameters:
        buyer - Is a Client object that references the client that wants to be added to the receipt. client!=null
        listProd - Is an ArrayList of Product that contains the list of products for the receipt. listProd!=null.
        listQ - Is an ArrayList of Integer that contains the list of quantities of products for the receipt. listQ!=null.
        paymentMethod - Is a String variable that contains the payment method of the receipt. paymentMethod equals "Efectivo", paymentMethod equals "Tarjeta de debito", paymentMethod equals "Tarjeta de credito", or paymentMethod equals "Transferencia bancaria"
        valuePayment - Is a double variable that contains the value of the first payment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        NoProductsAddedException -
        thrown if... 1. The list of products is empty.
        UnderAgeException -
        thrown if... 1. The buyer is under age and wants to buy an electronic equipment.
        NoPriceException -
        thrown if... 1. The value of the payment is zero.
        NegativePriceException -
        thrown if... 1. The value of the payment is negative.
        ExcessValueException -
        thrown if... 1. The value of the payment is greater than the total value of the products.

        ty - Is a TypeOfProduct object that represents a type of product of the system. ty!=null.
        newName - Is a String variable that contains the new name of a type of product. newName!=null and newName!="".
        enabled - Is a boolean variable that represents the new state of a type of product.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying updated, a variable that indicates if the type of product was updated successfully or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.

                                         java.lang.String name)

      • addProduct

        public void addProduct(TypeOfProduct type,
                       Brand b,
                       java.lang.String model,
                       int units,
                       double price,
                       boolean guarantee)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       NoQuantityException,
                       NegativeQuantityException,
                       NoPriceException,
                       NegativePriceException,
                       SameProductException
        This method adds a product to the system's list of products.
        name: addProduct
        pre: The objects type, brand, and the variables such as model, units, price and guarantee are already initialized.
        post: The product was added successfully or not.
        Parameters:
        type - Is a TypeOfProduct object that represents a type of product of the system. type!=null.
        b - Is a Brand object that represents a brand of the system. b!=null.
        units - Is an integer variable that contains the number of available units of a product.
        guarantee - Is a boolean variable that indicates if a product has guarantee or not.
        model - Is a String variable that contains the model of a product. model!=null and model!="".
        price - Is a double variable that contains the price of a product.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        NoQuantityException -
        thrown if units==0.
        NegativeQuantityException -
        thrown if units less than 0.
        NoPriceException -
        thrown if price==0.
        NegativePriceException -
        thrown if price less than 0.
        SameProductException -
        thrown if there is another product in the system with the same type, brand and model entered.

        post: A list of receipts that are in the date range entered was returned.

        finalDate - Is a Date object that contains the final date of a report. finalDate!=null.

        an ArrayList of Receipt selectedReceipts that contains all the receipts of the system that are in the date range entered.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException -
        thrown if it fails to parse a string that should have a special format.

      • exportUsersReport

        public void exportUsersReport(java.lang.String fn,
                              java.lang.String initialTime,
                              java.lang.String finalTime)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                              java.text.ParseException,
                              HigherDateAndHourException
        This method generates a report of users based on their number of receipts generated in a specific date range.
        name: exportsUsersReport
        pre: The variables initialDate, finalDate and fn are already initialized.
        post: A file with the report of users based on their number of receipts has been generated.
        Parameters:
        initialTime - Is a String variable that contains the initial date of a report. initiaDate!=null and initialDate!="".
        finalTime - Is a String variable that contains the final date of a report. finalDate!=null and finalDate!="".
        fn - Is a String variable that contains the path file where the report is going to be stored. fn!=null and fn!="".
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException -
        thrown if an attempt to open the file denoted by a specified pathname has failed.
        java.text.ParseException -
        thrown if an attempt to parse a string that should have a special format has failed.
        HigherDateAndHourException -
        thrown if the start date and time chosen are greater than the end date and time given to generate the report.
